entry.title: You're a Computer Athlete (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

You're a Computer Athlete

You're likely a professional computer user – you should behave like the athlete that you are

entry.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

entry.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

entry.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

entry.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

The case for standardizing gene nomenclature in vertebrates

  • Fiona M. McCarthy
  • Tamsin E. M. Jones
  • Elspeth A. Bruford
Matters Arising Open Access 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Reply to: The case for standardizing gene nomenclature in vertebrates (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Reply to: The case for standardizing gene nomenclature in vertebrates

  • Constantina Theofanopoulou
  • Erich D. Jarvis
Matters Arising Open Access 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Evidence for Dirac flat band superconductivity enabled by quantum geometry (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Evidence for Dirac flat band superconductivity enabled by quantum geometry

The authors investigate the effect of small velocity in a superconducting Dirac flat band system, finding evidence for small pairs and that superfluid stiffness is not dominated by kinetic energy.

  • Haidong Tian
  • Xueshi Gao
  • Marc W. Bockrath
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Spherical symmetry in the kilonova AT2017gfo/GW170817 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Spherical symmetry in the kilonova AT2017gfo/GW170817

Spectra taken after the kilonova associated with GW170817 show a high degree of spherical symmetry and a line shape is found that is consistent with a completely spherical expansion to within a few per cent.

  • Albert Sneppen
  • Darach Watson
  • Stuart Sim
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Core origin of seismic velocity anomalies at Earth’s core–mantle boundary (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Core origin of seismic velocity anomalies at Earth’s core–mantle boundary

Investigations of the crystallization of FeSi in Fe–Si–H melt under high pressure−temperature conditions provide evidence of a new process that explains geochemical and geophysical observations at the core–mantle boundary.

  • Suyu Fu
  • Stella Chariton
  • Sang-Heon Shim
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Electronic metadevices for terahertz applications (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Electronic metadevices for terahertz applications

Through microscopic manipulation of radiofrequency fields, a new class of compact terahertz devices is proposed, setting the stage for next-generation ultrafast semiconductor electronics.

  • Mohammad Samizadeh Nikoo
  • Elison Matioli
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Suppressed basal melting in the eastern Thwaites Glacier grounding zone (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Suppressed basal melting in the eastern Thwaites Glacier grounding zone

Despite observations from a hot-water-drilled access hole showing warm ocean waters beneath Thwaites Glacier Eastern Ice Shelf, the basal melt rate is strongly suppressed due to the low current speeds and strong density stratification.

  • Peter E. D. Davis
  • Keith W. Nicholls
  • Keith Makinson
Article Open Access 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Less extreme and earlier outbursts of ice-dammed lakes since 1900 (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Less extreme and earlier outbursts of ice-dammed lakes since 1900

An assessment of ice-dam failures in six mountain regions shows that extreme peak flows and volumes have declined sharply since 1900, and that ice-dam floods today originate at higher elevations and earlier in the year.

  • Georg Veh
  • Natalie Lützow
  • Oliver Korup
Article Open Access 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: A universal interface for plug-and-play assembly of stretchable devices (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A universal interface for plug-and-play assembly of stretchable devices

A universal interface connects soft, rigid and encapsulation modules together to form robust, stretchable devices in a plug-and-play manner by pressing without using pastes, which will simplify and accelerate development of on-skin and implantable devices.

  • Ying Jiang
  • Shaobo Ji
  • Xiaodong Chen
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: A NPAS4–NuA4 complex couples synaptic activity to DNA repair (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A NPAS4–NuA4 complex couples synaptic activity to DNA repair

A neuron-specific activity-dependent DNA repair mechanism is identified, the impairment of which may lead to neurodevelopmental disorders, neurodegeneration and ageing.

  • Elizabeth A. Pollina
  • Daniel T. Gilliam
  • Michael E. Greenberg
Article Open Access 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Effects of moisture and density-dependent interactions on tropical tree diversity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Effects of moisture and density-dependent interactions on tropical tree diversity

Moist soil strengthens density-dependent mortality with long-lasting effects on species diversity of tropical trees.

  • Edwin Lebrija-Trejos
  • Andrés Hernández
  • S. Joseph Wright
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Origination of the modern-style diversity gradient 15 million years ago (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Origination of the modern-style diversity gradient 15 million years ago

Quantification of planktonic fossils from the past 40 million years shows that the present-day diversity gradient arose only 15 million years ago as the climate started to cool.

  • Isabel S. Fenton
  • Tracy Aze
  • Erin E. Saupe
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Realization of a minimal Kitaev chain in coupled quantum dots (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Realization of a minimal Kitaev chain in coupled quantum dots

A minimal artificial Kitaev chain can be realized by using two spin-polarized quantum dots in an InSb nanowire strongly coupled by both elastic co-tunnelling and crossed Andreev reflection.

  • Tom Dvir
  • Guanzhong Wang
  • Leo P. Kouwenhoven
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Heterogeneous melting near the Thwaites Glacier grounding line (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Heterogeneous melting near the Thwaites Glacier grounding line

Thwaites Eastern Ice Shelf observations from a new underwater vehicle show that high melt rates occur where ice is sharply sloped at the ocean interface, with lower melt where the ice is comparatively flat.

  • B. E. Schmidt
  • P. Washam
  • K. Makinson
Article Open Access 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Late Cenozoic cooling restructured global marine plankton communities (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Late Cenozoic cooling restructured global marine plankton communities

Analysis of Triton, a high-resolution dataset documenting the macroperforate planktonic foraminifera fossil record, reveals a global climate-linked equatorward shift of ecological and morphological community equitability over the past 8 million years.

  • Adam Woodhouse
  • Anshuman Swain
  • Christopher M. Lowery
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Structure and thiazide inhibition mechanism of the human Na–Cl cotransporter (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structure and thiazide inhibition mechanism of the human Na–Cl cotransporter

Using cryo-electron microscopy, the structures of human Na–Cl cotransporter are determined alone and in complex with a thiazide diuretic.

  • Minrui Fan
  • Jianxiu Zhang
  • Liang Feng
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Autonomous self-burying seed carriers for aerial seeding (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Autonomous self-burying seed carriers for aerial seeding

A study describes a wood-based, three-tailed, biodegradable seed carrier that self-drills into the ground in response to moisture fluctuations with a success rate higher than that of natural self-drilling seeds.

  • Danli Luo
  • Aditi Maheshwari
  • Lining Yao
Article 15 Feb 2023

entry.title: Enantioselective Transition-Metal Catalysis via an Anion-Binding Approach (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Enantioselective Transition-Metal Catalysis via an Anion-Binding Approach

  • John M. Ovian
  • Petra Vojáčková
  • Eric N. Jacobsen
Article 14 Feb 2023

entry.content:
The structural basis for HIV-1 Vif antagonism of human APOBEC3G

  • Yen-Li Li
